intro: Leontodon recognitus, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, grass-like leaves and yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides, meadows, and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized in various regions.
